channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nvidia takes a $5.5 billion hit from a new Trump ban that could also hasten China’s push to make its own chips
item.description: Nvidia's shares plunged almost 7% in after-market trading, amid a broader slump in global markets as Trump's new ban intensifies a U.S.-China tech war...

item.title: What to Know About Today’s Meth
item.description: The highly addictive drug, manufactured almost exclusively by Mexican cartels, is more dangerous than ever. Its use has been surging across the countr...

item.title: UK Supreme Court Says Trans Women Are Not Legally Women Under Equality Act
item.description: Britain’s Supreme Court ruled that the word “woman” refers to biological sex under the country’s anti-discrimination law, in a blow to trans rights ac...

item.title: ‘China’s Elon Musk’ uses just two numbers to demonstrate why his country’s auto industry is now outcompeting the U.S. and Europe
item.description: Xiaopeng He used two numbers to describe the breakneck pace of EV innovation in China.

item.title: Spotify appears to be having a major outage right now
item.description: The music streamer says it's looking into the issue.

item.title: Law Firms Made Deals With Trump. Now He Wants More From Them.
item.description: To avoid retribution, big firms agreed to provide free legal services for uncontroversial causes. To the White House, that could mean negotiating trad...

item.title: Exclusive: Senators Elizabeth Warren and Andy Kim demand investigation into DOGE cuts at CFPB
item.description: Warren, who conceived of and oversaw the creation of the financial watchdog agency after the financial crisis, is now trying to defend it.

item.title: Hunting the Wild Mushrooms of New York City
item.description: There are thousands of species of fungus in the city, with names like American dyeball, dingy twiglet and devil’s dipstick. Some even glow in the dark...

item.title: I’m a Columbia Professor. Here’s the Really Disheartening Part of This Mess.
item.description: Where were these voices when the university was under assault from the Trump administration?

item.title: Why a top HR executive at PwC says that in an AI-fueled labor market ‘skills are currency’
item.description: Managing director Kimberly Jones says that employees at the company pick who they want to work with based on their skills, not titles.

item.title: UK Supreme Court Says Trans Women Are Not Legally Women Under Equality Act
item.description: Britain’s Supreme Court ruled that the word “woman” refers to biological sex under the country’s anti-discrimination law, in a blow to trans rights ac...

item.title: British Court Rules Legal Definition of Women Is Based on Biological Sex
item.description: Britain’s Supreme Court ruled on Wednesday that trans women do not meet the legal definition of women under the country’s Equality Act. However, the c...

item.title: Pope Francis Thanks Doctors and Nurses for His Recovery
item.description: Although the pontiff has begun meeting with more people, he remains frail and will not lead important Easter events, the Vatican announced.

item.title: R.S.F. in Sudan Declare Parallel Government Amid Assault on Zamzam Camp
item.description: The United Nations said that at least 300 people were killed when the armed group, the Rapid Support Forces, stormed a camp in Darfur.

item.title: Italy’s Meloni Heads to Washington to Meet Trump. Will It Pay Off for Europe?
